titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Richard T. Jacob
CWG6987

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Covington Ky Sept 20. 1865
Gov R. T. Jacobs
Frankfort Ky
Governor:

The enclosed remission was handed to me this morning by the marshal to present to the court. Upon presenting it and examining the record, it was discovered that no "bail bond" had been executed in the case but that Coleby had deposited the money with the clerk ($1000) in lien of the bail bond.
The remission therefore misdescribes the case. It should have been for "the return of the deposit as bail or surety for the appearance of Tho Jones except fees and costs.
Will your Excellency make the correction

Kenton Cir Ct
vs
Saml Coleby
$1000,
21st Sept/65
This was remitted on the 27th July/65, but was not in form & did not State the case
